intro: Synadenium molle, commonly known as the soft synadenium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The leaves are usually broad and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in its native habitat.
